events.originalText: 2008 TC3 exploded above the Nubian Desert in Sudan, in the first time that an asteroid impact had been predicted prior to atmospheric entry.
events.subtitle: 2008 TC3
events.headline: 2008 TC3 Explodes Above Nubian Desert in Sudan

events.originalText: Anna Politkovskaya (pictured), a Russian journalist and human-rights activist, was assassinated in the elevator of her apartment block in Moscow.
events.subtitle: Anna Politkovskaya
events.headline: Russian Journalist Anna Politkovskaya Assassinated in Moscow

events.originalText: Croatian War of Independence: The Yugoslav People's Army conducted an air strike on Banski Dvori, the official residence of the president of Croatia in Zagreb.
events.subtitle: Croatian War of Independence
events.headline: Yugoslav People's Army Conducts Air Strike on Croatian President's Residence in Zagreb

events.originalText: Near Point Barrow in Alaska, an Iñupiat hunter discovered three gray whales trapped in pack ice, which resulted in an international effort to free them.
events.subtitle: Point Barrow
events.headline: Iñupiat Hunter Discovers Three Gray Whales Trapped in Pack Ice Near Point Barrow

events.originalText: During severe floods in Puerto Rico, about 130 people died as a result of the deadliest single landslide on record in North America.
events.subtitle: 1985 Puerto Rico floods
events.headline: Severe Floods in Puerto Rico Result in 130 Deaths from Deadliest Landslide in North America

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Sonderkommando work-unit members in Auschwitz concentration camp revolted upon learning that they were due to be killed; although a few managed to escape, most were massacred on the same day.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Sonderkommando Members Revolt in Auschwitz Concentration Camp

events.originalText: Georgia Tech defeated Cumberland University 222–0 in the most lopsided college football game in American history.
events.subtitle: Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football
events.headline: Georgia Tech Defeats Cumberland University 222–0 in College Football Game

events.originalText: Japan captured Pohnpei from Germany, eventually leading to large-scale Japanese immigration to Micronesia.
events.subtitle: Pohnpei
events.headline: Japan Captures Pohnpei from Germany

events.originalText: The state funeral of Mindon Min (pictured), who ruled Myanmar for 25 years, took place; his death was reportedly preceded by strange omens, and his senior princes were unable to attend as they had all been arrested.
events.subtitle: Death and state funeral of Mindon Min
events.headline: State Funeral of Mindon Min Takes Place in Myanmar

events.originalText: Cornell University in Ithaca, New York, was established, with an initial enrollment of 412 men the next day.
events.subtitle: Cornell University
events.headline: Cornell University Established in Ithaca, New York

events.originalText: Ōdate, the last castle of the Satake clan in Japan's Tōhoku region, was captured during the Boshin War.
events.subtitle: Satake clan
events.headline: Last Castle of Satake Clan Captured in Japan's Tōhoku Region

events.originalText: The French privateer Robert Surcouf led a 150-man crew to capture the 40-gun, 437-man East Indiaman Kent.
events.subtitle: Privateer
events.headline: French Privateer Robert Surcouf Captures East Indiaman Kent

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Patriots and Loyalist militias engaged each other at the Battle of Kings Mountain in South Carolina.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Battle of Kings Mountain Fought in South Carolina During American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: King George III issued a royal proclamation that forbade British settlement of much of newly acquired French territory in North America, reserving the land for indigenous peoples.
events.subtitle: George III
events.headline: King George III Issues Proclamation Forbidding British Settlement in North America

events.originalText: Ottoman–Habsburg wars: The Battle of Lepanto was fought near the Gulf of Corinth, a significant setback for the Ottoman Empire and the last major naval battle fought entirely with galleys.
events.subtitle: Ottoman–Habsburg wars
events.headline: Battle of Lepanto Fought Near Gulf of Corinth

events.originalText: Spanish explorer Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo became the first European to set foot on Santa Catalina Island, off the coast of California.
events.subtitle: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo
events.headline: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo First European to Set Foot on Santa Catalina Island

events.originalText: War of the League of Cambrai: A Venetian army under Bartolomeo d'Alviano was decisively defeated by the Spanish army commanded by Ramón de Cardona and Fernando d'Ávalos.
events.subtitle: War of the League of Cambrai
events.headline: Venetian Army Defeated by Spanish Army in War of the League of Cambrai
